results.title: In ‘Smile,’ Why the Grins Are So Grim
results.abstract: Parker Finn, the director of the new horror film where characters smile before death, said the secret to making a smile creepy was in the eyes.

multimedia.caption: Caitlin Stasey in “Smile.”
Caitlin Stasey in “Smile.”

results.title: Da’Vine Joy Randolph Doesn’t Want Anyone Finishing Her Sentences
results.abstract: Whether in comedies like “Only Murders in the Building” or dramas like “On the Come Up,” the ubiquitous actor refuses to be pigeonholed.
des_facet: Only Murders in the Building (TV Program)

multimedia.caption: Da’Vine Joy Randolph, center, with her arm around Jamila C. Gray in “On the Come Up.”

results.title: Stream These Three Great Documentaries
results.abstract: The bonds of an eccentric mother and daughter, of residents of New Orleans and of the family and friends of a kidnapping victim are explored in this month’s documentary picks.

multimedia.caption: Edie Beale in the documentary “Grey Gardens.”

results.title: ‘Bros’ Fails at the Box Office, as ‘Smile’ Arrives at No. 1
results.abstract: Promoted as the first gay romantic comedy from a major studio, “Bros” sold $4.8 million in tickets, about 40 percent less than expected.

multimedia.caption: Luke Macfarlane and Billy Eichner in “Bros,” which was embraced by critics but arrived in fourth place at the box office.
Luke Macfarlane and Billy Eichner in “Bros,” which was embraced by critics but arrived in fourth place at the box office.
Luke Macfarlane and Billy Eichner in “Bros,” which was embraced by critics but arrived in fourth place at the box office.

results.title: The New York Film Festival: Movies for Art’s Sake
results.abstract: In “Tár,” “Showing Up” and other selections, the annual event makes the case for big-screen aesthetics and large-scale ambitions.

multimedia.caption: Cate Blanchett as a conductor caught up in a #MeToo scandal of her own making in “Tár.”
Cate Blanchett as a conductor caught up in a #MeToo scandal of her own making in “Tár.”

results.title: ‘Blonde’ Review: Exploiting Marilyn Monroe for Old Times’ Sake
results.abstract: She was an actress of uncommon talent. But once again a director is more interested in examining her body (literally, in this case) than getting inside her mind.

multimedia.caption: In “Blonde,” Ana de Armas, right, is a fine if overwhelmed Marilyn Monroe, with Bobby Cannavale playing a character based on Joe DiMaggio, her second husband.
In “Blonde,” Ana de Armas, right, is a fine if overwhelmed Marilyn Monroe, with Bobby Cannavale playing a character based on Joe DiMaggio, her second husband.
In “Blonde,” Ana de Armas, right, is a fine if overwhelmed Marilyn Monroe, with Bobby Cannavale playing a character based on Joe DiMaggio, her second husband.

results.title: Welcome to Peter Strickland’s Worlds
results.abstract: The British filmmaker crafts strange, offbeat cinematic universes. His latest, “Flux Gourmet,” reveals his affinity with sound in new ways.

multimedia.caption: A “Peter Strickland world,” said Fatma Mohamed, who has starred in all his features, is “funny, sensual, weird and joyful.”
multimedia.copyright: Tom Jamieson for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Bros’ Review: Boy Meets Boy Meets Multiplex
results.abstract: Billy Eichner plays a moody podcaster who has sworn off relationships, but just might find himself in one anyway, in this gay romantic comedy.

results.abstract: Walter Hill’s lean, mean shoot-’em-up is a master class in B-movie craft.

results.title: Angelina Jolie Details Abuse Allegations Against Brad Pitt in Countersuit
results.abstract: In court papers related to a legal battle over a French winery they once owned together, she claims that he was abusive to her and their children during a 2016 plane ride.

multimedia.caption: Angelina Jolie countersued her ex-husband Brad Pitt as part of a legal battle over a winery they once owned together.

results.title: The ’90s Cartoon That Mattered? ‘Beavis and Butt-Head.’ (Fight Me.)
results.abstract: It doesn’t make best-of lists, but the series, then and now, was always much smarter than its characters, and it didn’t try too hard. Sorry, Bart Simpson.
des_facet: Beavis and Butt-Head Do the Universe (Movie)

results.title: Will Smith Film ‘Emancipation’ Will Be Released in December
results.abstract: Apple said the movie, Mr. Smith’s first since his infamous slap at the Oscars, will be in theaters on Dec. 2 and begin streaming on Dec. 9.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

multimedia.caption: There had been questions about whether Apple would release “Emancipation” this year or delay it until 2023.
There had been questions about whether Apple would release “Emancipation” this year or delay it until 2023.
There had been questions about whether Apple would release “Emancipation” this year or delay it until 2023.

results.title: Sacheen Littlefeather, Activist Who Rejected Brando’s Oscar, Dies at 75
results.abstract: The actress was booed at the Academy Awards in 1973 after she refused the best actor award on Marlon Brando’s behalf in protest of Hollywood’s depictions of Native Americans.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

multimedia.caption: Ms. Littlefeather with the speech she began delivering but never finished at the Oscars ceremony in 1973. She and Mr. Brando had become friends through her neighbor the director Francis Ford Coppola.
Ms. Littlefeather with the speech she began delivering but never finished at the Oscars ceremony in 1973. She and Mr. Brando had become friends through her neighbor the director Francis Ford Coppola.
Ms. Littlefeather with the speech she began delivering but never finished at the Oscars ceremony in 1973. She and Mr. Brando had become friends through her neighbor the director Francis Ford Coppola.

results.title: Billy Eichner Wrote Himself Into the Romance He Wanted With ‘Bros’
results.abstract: In the film, he channels his relationship angst into something hopeful: “I was like, ‘Why is the fictional version of me happier than I am?’”

multimedia.caption: “Until very recently, if Hollywood was willing to put a gay character in anything, it was often to be some version of a live-action cartoon,” Billy Eichner said.
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.title: Film Festival Season Comes to New York
results.abstract: The New York region has a flurry of film festivals kicking off over the next few weeks, with several high-profile movies debuting. Here’s what to look out for.

results.title: The Empty Spectacle of Marilyn Monroe’s Fantasy Fetus
results.abstract: “Blonde” pretends to imagine how Monroe would have felt about her pregnancies. Instead, it jarringly shoves a C.G.I. fetus into her midcentury mind.

multimedia.caption: In “Blonde,” Marilyn Monroe conceives a beatific, telepathic C.G.I. fetus.
In “Blonde,” Marilyn Monroe conceives a beatific, telepathic C.G.I. fetus.

results.title: ‘Mona Lisa and the Blood Moon’ Review: Escape From New Orleans
results.abstract: This hyper-stylized quasi-superhero movie by Ana Lily Amirpour follows a mental hospital patient with supernatural abilities; it looks a lot more fun than it actually is.

results.title: ‘What We Leave Behind’ Review: A Father’s Final Project
results.abstract: At 89, Julián Moreno began building a home in Mexico for his children who had immigrated to the U.S. His granddaughter made the poignant documentary “What We Leave Behind.”

multimedia.caption: Julián Moreno in the documentary “What We Leave Behind.”
Julián Moreno in the documentary “What We Leave Behind.”
Julián Moreno in the documentary “What We Leave Behind.”

results.title: ‘Sirens’ Review: The Risk in Rocking Out in Beirut
results.abstract: A documentary about an all-female metal group in Lebanon shows the difficulties of asserting complex identities in a repressive environment.

multimedia.caption: In “Sirens,” Lilas Mayassi and Shery Bechara, the founders of the Lebanese thrash metal band Slave to Sirens, have a rough road ahead of them.

results.title: ‘I Didn’t See You There’ Review: A View From His Seat
results.abstract: The filmmaker Reid Davenport, by turns pensive and irritated, takes viewers inside his life as a disabled person through footage shot entirely from his perspective.
